Reviews.Title: “Sleep, Park and fly, great deal for travelers!”
Reviews.Author: bigbuck
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the "Quality Hotel" for many years, especially when I have a morning flight leaving from the Montreal airport. The traffic in Montreal can be horrendous at times in the mornings while trying to cross the island with all the bridges etc. I have also sent many clients of mine to this hotel over the years. The rooms are always very clean, comfortable and include amenities like free Wi-fi etc.. The food is moderately priced in the restaurant and the bar and is usually very accommodating. The rates are also very decent, considering that you are almost in Montreal. The hotel is very well situated near the Montreal International airport on Cote De Liesse boulevard. The hotel shuttle service to and from the airport is also very punctual while operating 24 hours a day, every half an hour from the hotel. I have always found the drivers very helpful with pick-ups on the return flights and also with all the luggage handling etc. Park and fly...a great new package for the traveler! The hotel offers special "park and fly" rate packages to travelers who book a night at the hotel the opportunity to leave their vehicles in the hotel's long term parking areas for periods of up to 2 weeks. The parking area is very secure with attendants and gates. You can also have an option to park in an inside and heated area. ( $30.00 more ) They even will wash your vehicle for you while you are away. I parked in the secure outside area and with the cost of the room for one night, including 1 week of parking, free shuttles etc. the total cost was $179.00 CDN. Not a bad deal considering what the normal cost of parking a vehicle at the airport for a week would be. If you stay at the new "Airport Marriot Hotel," connected to the airport, the cost will be more than double this total amount. You might want to consider the Quality Hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “DOUBLE CHECK WHAT THEY WILL BILL YOUR CREDIT CARD”
Reviews.Author: Sidneynordsat
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night in Jan 2012 used the fly&park the clerk said it was $136.00 + 4 extra parking days at $9.00 a day when I got my credit card bill in the mail the total cost was $272.57 no need to say that they won't stiff me again I had read a review in the past that they practice this kind of over charge but figured i'll make sure with the clerk and it happened to me SO BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Quality is not a name for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BD700
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in December 2011. The only good thing about the hotel was the bed was comfortable. In its day I am sure it was OK but, now it needs a refurb. However the biggest issue is the quality of service. The breakfast lounge was poor and the service worse. Overall management of the hotel leaves something to be desired

Reviews.Title: “old dirty noisy”
Reviews.Author: 2010UltraLimited
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and dirty.The elevators sound like they are going to break down.The staff in the restaurant are very slow and you have to go and get them in order to place dinner orders.The beds are lumpy Bathrooms are old and dirty looking.There are noisy garbage trucks i n the alley early in the morning.Went to the lobby in the morning to get a coffee and the pot was empty so i went to ask front desk if there was anymore coffee and they didnt even acknowledge my presence.waited for 5 minutes the clerk walked past me 3 times so i left Also the restaurant is very expensive for average food and rotten service

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: CedricNYC
Reviews.Content: My connecting flight to NYC was cancelled so the airline, Air France, booked me a room in this hotel in order to wait for the next plane in the following day. While I appreciated Air France's help this hotel was very bad. Here is a quick summary of my bad experience: 1) Despite large signs saying "smoking not permitted" , my room (and at least ALL rooms in the first floor as other people were complaining too) had a strong smell of cigarette smoke. I am not talking about a slight smell, I am talking about a strong old and cold cigarette smell that can make you feel dizzy if you are not a smoker. 2) Service is BAD: when I went to the front desk to explain the cigarette smell problem, the old men at the front desk denied that it could smell like cigarette (despite the fact that other hotel guests had complained before and after me). Then when I asked to change room, he offered to send someone with a machine that removes bad smell. When the person showed up in my room he actually only had some generic febreze and offered to leave the windows open (it was about 32 degrees F. or 0 degrees Celcius outside). 3) Rooms are dirty: there were bread crumbs on the desk, soap marks in the sink etc. 4) They charged my credit card about $7 for things (not sure what) that I didn't buy. Did they try to take advantage of the fact that I was just a transit traveler who may not bother disputing such charges in a different country? Overall if you are stucked in Montreal Airport for the night, I would highly recommend to go to another hotel. Even if you will have to spend more to go somewhere else is well worth it! Side note: When I asked the old men at the front desk how many starts this hotel has he replied: "this is a 4 start hotel". Really?

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Bartek S
Reviews.Content: Very good service!!! The front desk staff was very nice. Nice and clean room. No restaurants near the hotel so we tried the restaurant/bar of the hotel ans the food was amazing and the sevice also. Excellent shuttle service to airport.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel with all the amenities you could wish for !”
Reviews.Author: sharon l
Reviews.Content: the proximity to the airport with shuttle service and long stay parking was greatly appreciated. The room was beautifully decorated with everything you could possibly need and every service was offered.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DarrenLund
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Montreal, and the wife book this hotel. We traveled with our two teenage daughters and our chocolate labrador. When we first arrived, we loved the size of the room, and it even had a mini fridge, sink, and microwave. We needed some extra bedding, and it was brought promptly. The wife and daughters used the pool and the exercise room, which they all loved. I was quite impressed when I asked where the nearest store was, as we wanted some milk, and their courtesy van, drove me to the grocery store, and since I only needed one item, he waited for me. On the way back, he told me that he often drives people to the movies, shopping malls, grocery store, as well as shuttling people to the airport. There was lots of green space outside, for our dog, to do her business, and lots of garbage cans so I could dispose of her droppings. The staff was really friendly and helpful, making our stay that more enjoyable. I have no problems booking back there, when I get another chance to go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Secure”
Reviews.Author: F1Q
Reviews.Content: Downtown hotels were booked and had to stay near the airport. Hotel was clean and satff were friendly. Was quiet even though it was across the street from the airport. Nothing really around it. Secure outdoor parking and easy highway access.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty aged room, and poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Puffin30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Aug 11th while passing through from Ontario headed to halifax for our holidays. We arrived at 2am which think I is common in this area because they are close to the airport. Desk staff not friendly at all, although I am not fluent in French nor am I in Grunting which is pretty much how I was spoken to. Once up to the room it was very dated, carpets were filthy and stained and the bathroom tub surround had mold growing on it, needless to say I did not take my shoes off. On a posirtive note Front Desk was much more pleasant upon check out!

Reviews.Title: “Should change the name to Quality Out”
Reviews.Author: lupaloup
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for my husband at the Quality Inn in Dorval airport foolishly thinking that the service and the place would be nice. I am a choices hotel member and I go regularly in their hotels so I thought that their sevice and hotel would be the same or at least adequate....WRONG. When I called to have certain informations about the shuttle service the first time I waited at least 15 minutes till someone answer me. Then the night before my husband arrival I called to make sure the room would be charge to my credit card and not his; again it took forever before I could speak to someone. The person told me that she was sorry for the wait but that they are really under staff.....Why didn't I click to that message...foolish of me. By the way they took my credit card number but surely they charged the room to my husband credit card!"/$%%??&?&** When my husband got to the hotel he waited 1 hour for check in they another hour to get get his car parked , so it took him 2 hours to get to his room Sorry we are understaff the frontguest clerck told him. Then I tried to called to his room....I was put on wait and 18 minutes ( I counted them) and I ask to 3 differents persons before they put me through his room. Of the 3 I talk to 2 told me ' One moment sorry we are understaffed' So my experience and my husband's was very bad He didn't not return yet from his trip hopefully his car is still there... Don't ever ever book a room there, they are cheap and the service is the worst. Sorry Honey !

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is not 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: dana925
Reviews.Content: After one day driving from Toronoto to the hotel, we were extremely tired. After served by an unexperienced front desk girl (always seek the assistance from her colleague), we ran into the room for the rest. After we entered room, we were so depressed. The room was small, with a strange smell, with the expansion of the sofa bed (as we are a family travelers), we could not find the space to put our 3 luggages. We were so angry and ran back to the front desk. Luckly, the experienced front desk assistance, Marilena, received us, calmed us down and tried her best to find alternative solution for us, as my son is 6 feet tall and can not be accommodated in that sofa bed. The hotel is so lucky to hire this very friendly and professional staff, Marilena, who does know her responsibility and is willing to offer the help to the guests. We felt much better after her assistance. If we travelled to Montreal again, we would stay this hotel only becasue of this lady, Marilena.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and over priced, nice outdoor swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: powal
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel SO does not match the quality. Corridors were filthy during our stay, the room smelled of smoke and the guy in the bar was rude. They even charged an additional 9 CAD for parking per night. They advertise that they there is a safe in the room, but this is only true for some rooms. For other rooms you are out of luck, no safe at the front desk. There was no wireless internet, only wired. The outdoor swimming pool was however really nice, and is the only reason why I give this hotel a rate 2 instead of one. We were allowed to have a pic nic by the pool which was really cool. All credits to the life guard! We stayed here only because it was the only option during the Montreal Jazz Festival.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: canuck255
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a park and fly package (left our car there during our trip). When our flight landed, we checked in for some much needed rest after jet lag. As soon as we opened the door to the room, I immediately wanted to go home! The bed was creaky, lumpy and there were cobwebs on the ceiling. Needs to be gutted.

Reviews.Title: “Tobacco-smoke filled dump”
Reviews.Author: 2-time_aruba_visitor
Reviews.Content: What can I say - this was a Grand Prix weekend, and I needed a room for 1 night. I should have paid double or triple but avoided this dump. The "non-smoking" room - well, it was probably non-smoking since the afternoon on the day that i arrived. TV's "on" button was busted, the only channels were adult and PPV. Shower sprayed water everywhere, except where I intended it to. The pillows were terrible, the bed looked very old. There was a very small fridge however. The internet (wired) in the room was broken. They promised free parking right beside the hotel - but later i realized that there was $14 charge for the night. The front desk was rude, unhelpful and belligerent. Avoid this place or minimize your stay there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “RUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: NMProfessor
Reviews.Content: Do not, I repeat, do not, stay at this hotel. We stayed there one night on the way back to the states from Paris. I should have known it was a dump when it was the only hotel available (Montreal was having a Grand Prix race and everything else was booked solid). The lobby was stuck in a strange 1970's Asian motif, the front desk staff rude and indifferent to our arrival. The hallways were long, dark, and very "Shining-esque." Once we entered the room, the flourescent overhead light was flickering and making a dying sound. The carpets were dirty and worn. There were nice comforters on the beds, but also dark hairs in the sheets. Yuck!! The bathroom was the worst of all. The tub had one of those fiberglass surround walls, divided top and bottom. It looked clean, but once I actually sat in the tub, I could see a line of mildew and god-only-knows-what around where the two pieces came together. It was totally disgusting! Room service took over an hour, and the food was so-so, but expensive. The room itself was also expensive--$229 Canadian. If we hadn't been so exhausted from our trip, or there had been other rooms at nearby hotels, we would have left immediately. And when we did leave the next morning, the morning front desk guy took our key and said, "ok. Bye." No "thanks for staying", nothing. I seriously do not know how this hell hole stays in business.

Reviews.Title: “Quality much better in Canada vs US!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandCommuter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here very briefly. Comfy bed, lower to the ground than usual. Bed had lots of pillows! Friendly staff at check in. Van prompt for airport pick up/drop off. Friendly van driver! Room temp stayed cool, yeah!

Reviews.Title: “Always comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fred S
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for the last 15 years or so. I travel to the Dorval area for business and, though I have tried one or two other hotels in the area I am now committed to this one each time I come. Staff are always friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable and amenities like restaurant, bar, internet, airport bus service are very good.

Reviews.Title: “We Love it”
Reviews.Author: jnkcks
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations. It wa very clean with efficeint room serviceand free internet. The staff was always ready to respond to all our queries and requests. Everything is very organized. Being very close to the airport is an added benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, excellent staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Lullan
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel conveniently located near the aiprort and offering excellent value for the price. Courteous staff and pleasant decor makes stay a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: torontobiz_10
Reviews.Content: It was an absolutely fine experience, and I have no issues whatsoever. The only reason it was exceeded my expectations is simply that that rating would be reserved for a hotel that is really in a different sphere of accommodations. For a 'corporate' stay it was lovely. There is nothing else that I could have asked for. Service was exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: iravlas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel only one night, did not get chance to look around. I forgot one item in the room next morning, and later requested it back. I've got $143 charges on my credit card for shipping the item back, but my item never arrived. I kept calling the Hotel, but Hotel stuff simply hang up on me. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal and Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: Sam0611
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its great parking deal--we stayed one night at a regular rate and could leave our car free for the next ten days. It was such a deal that I didn't expect much, but I was wrong. The service was outstanding, the lobby was elegant for a standard hotel, and the amenities very interesting--including original Asian art on the walls everywhere. Even the guys in the parking garage were friendly and enjoyable to talk with, and everyone we met there seemed to truly like their jobs. When I spoke to the woman at the night desk to pay my compliments on the hotel, she was so pleased by what I said that she called the owner at his home so I could tell him my impressions directly. And yes, the chocolate in the rooms was an added treat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Rita1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay for one night at the Quality Hotel Dorval. The hotel is situated just 10 minutes away from the major airport. We took a Park and Fly package that allowed us to leave our vehicle in an indoor secure parking garage for the two weeks while we went on vacation. In addition to this special offer, the hotel offers a 24 hour complimentary shuttle service directly to the airport. This service was very convenient for us because we had an early flight at 8am and had to be at the airport for 5am. The shuttle service was punctual. As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a courteous, helpful and competent staff. This made our check in easy and efficient. When we arrived to our room, we had a chocolate plate with our name written on it in chocolate. Our room was very neat and spacious and the bed was super comfortable. We had a delicious dinner with a complimentary glass of wine in the restaurant. The restaurant staff was very friendly and the service was exceptional. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Quality Hotel Dorval and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the hotel service”
Reviews.Author: gnegm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long week-end and we enjoyed our staying. The pool is very nice and the room was clean and spacious. The hotel location is ideal becase it is near the airport and 10min from downtown. I recommend the Quality hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service, and overall experience, of any hotel”
Reviews.Author: kintleko
Reviews.Content: I got stuck at the airport & was sent to this hotel. Though everything seemed nice, the front desk staff were very rude, especially the woman, who kept me on hold for 11 minutes while I tried to get a wake up call. Also, they gave me a SMOKING room when I requested non-smoking, which stunk. Secondly, a guest screamed and fought with her estranged husband all night, leading many of us to call the police. Despite this fact, we were haunted by screams for help and pounding on the doors, and I could not reach the front desk from 12AM-3AM (time she was screaming and keeping us all up). Very weird. Lastly, when it couldn't get any worse, I find today that they overcharged my credit card for dinner and DID NOT take the 10 bucks off I was awarded for using an airline voucher. Altogether, the most terrible service and experience I've ever had in 20 years of traveling for work. Please, give your money to people who deserve it and will respect you as a guest!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away...even if Air Canada sends you here”
Reviews.Author: MotoJax
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at Quality Hotel earlier this month when our flight was delayed. Room still had garbage in it, was musty, and the floors were filthy. The people in the restaurant were unbelievably rude. It's understandable that on a Monday night that they would be understaffed...it's quite another to be scolded for simply asking for a table. The hotel cannot handle large overflows from the airlines. Shuttle service was the only pleasant part of the trip. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Stars and not a real "Quality Inn"”
Reviews.Author: SamuelChamplain
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night with my kids for a family reunion, so we didn't spend much time in the room or in the hotel. I was first attracted there by the great rate for the location, but I discovered that they charged for parking which is very unusual in this area. So take this into account when comparing prices with other hotels in the area. The bed were very comfortable and we had a very nice night of sleep. The room was tiny and we had barely enough space to move in the room. There was no room to place opened suitcases. The bathroom was also very small with no counter at all. It was not so clean : I found many hairs on the floor and on the sink, which were not ours.... I found this a bit discusting.... Felt like staying at someone else's place.... I have stayed in many others "Quality Inn" properties and this hotel doesn't fit in. So don't be fooled by the name. It is more like an an "Econo Lodge" at best. I don't see why they have 4 stars either. Maybe because they have a restaurant...? You should consider this like an average 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “not a great hotel:(”
Reviews.Author: amyandandrew
Reviews.Content: My stay was't great we had no hot water and the internet in the room was not working. The staff member at the hotel front desk was very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Bad (and isolated) - but not the worse out there..”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews of this place are fairly accurate and consistent - all for good reason. I don't think this hotel warrants just one star - there are a few reasons why I think it deserves two. It has a restaurant. It has a pool. It certainly is not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but would I recommend it to anyone? Probably not. It's hard to understand the reasoning behind the theme of the Quality Hotel Dorval. It is done up in an Asian theme, similar to what I've experienced in say, Vietnam, and I'm not really sure why. It oddly stands out when you enter the lobby and becomes quite apparent in the rooms. Sometimes lobbies can be deceiving - they look really nice and then you get to the rooms and are surprised about how poor they are. This is not the case here. You get a very good idea of what the hotel is like basd on the lobby. It's lit poorly, has a Koi pond (for no reason) and is dated. Check-in like most hotels is done efficiently. The rooms are comfortable enough for a 2 star hotel. There is an unneccesary abundance of pillows on the bed and some Asian artwork on the walls. The rooms also contain a desk and sitting spot which while handy, also makes the room look very cramped. There is a small fridge in the room as well which I always find helpful. Bathrooms are relatively tiny and I find the fake flowers to be gross, rather than appealing as I imagine they would like. Aside from the odd decor, the rooms are obviously dated but functional. I've had problems with the heat/AC before as well and there is the persistent problem of the smell of cigarette smoke filling the room when the heater fan blows. Internet connection is available by hardwire in the room for free (and also in the lobby if you need it). There are two eating establishments in the hotel - a bar and a restaurant. Both serve food that I find largely to be bland and mildly expensive. I haven't really found anything good on the menu yet but some of my co-workers seem to love the pizza. One of the more positive points to this hotel is the outdoor pool, which is wonderful during Montreal's hot summers. However in the winter, this is a huge downside with no pool inside the hotel. There is an indoor hottub though, located beside the fitness equipment. However as such, working out in the 'gym' of this hotel is unpleasant due to the heat and humidity given off by the tub. The worst part of this property is its location. It is by absolutely nothing! I've actually never stayed in a place that is so isolated before. There is a Tim Hortons across the highway, but that requires a walk down two blocks and under a darkly lit underpass. This option is not practical at night or in the winter. There is a Hilton Garden Inn next door that also has a restaurant, though I'm not sure the calibre of food is any better or diverse than the Quality Hotel. Overall there are much worse places you could be staying but this hotel really isn't all that great. it's in the middle of an office park (therefore, nowhere), has an odd theme to it with average rooms and poor food service. Would I stay here if I had the choice? No - but you can sleep comfortably here if you have to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Dattio
Reviews.Content: No service, Room issues include: worn bedding, hair dryer and power in bathroom not working, toilet screwed up, tap lifts of sink trying to turn on. No food for breakfast buffet, continental had no choice in healthy baked items. Don't stay here unless your desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Mixing smoking and non smoking room is a no-no”
Reviews.Author: Denys222
Reviews.Content: Our plane to Mexico was grounded because they had a generator problem,so United Airlines put us up in this hotel until next morning flight. On the way to our rooms we saw some smoking rooms and associated smell but when we got to our room doors were posted with non smoking signs and could hardly smeel cigarettes butts. Found out later that night that room past ours was smoking room.Did not want to move all the luggage again so we put up with it. Slept pretty good. Front desk staff was fine.Ate at the restaurant for lunch and dinner. Meals were excellent. Had the same judging look from restaurant staff than at the Best Western the week before.Wake up Montreal, clean jeans are in fashion in the rest of Canada

Reviews.Title: “definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobby075
Reviews.Content: we were so surprised to see 4 star signs posted on the web and on the hotel building. we had trouble pulling out the sofa bed although the housekeeper finally did it for us. However, for the price we paid, it is o.k in general. It should be a 2 star hotel, and definitely not a 4 star. For someone who wishes to sight see Montreal, it is too far and inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Surpsiingly nice for an airport motel in an industrial area”
Reviews.Author: JohnTheBear
Reviews.Content: Despite a minor dispute (resolved) with management over pet charges, I am still giving this place five stars. Not only were the rooms comfortable but a personalized welcome is drizzled on a plate in chocolate for each guest. Instead of boring hotel decor, the rooms and hallways are decorarated with lively Indian art and each room contains a live plant. Cleanliness was superlative. Restaurant has nice breakfast offerings. Internet access is provided both as wireless and cable and desk lamps have a convenient computer plug.

Reviews.Title: “A good motel”
Reviews.Author: Moutarde22
Reviews.Content: Got stuck at this hotel because on our way back from Amsterdam, we didn't get in Montreal in time to connect to our flight for Toronto. This is pretty basic stuff. It's a motel more than a hotel. At least, it look that way in the section that we were. The room was ok, but it could have been more clean. The location is probably good if you've got a car or if you're counting on the airport shuttle, but there's nothing interesting close to the hotel. We ordered food in the room. Very expansive for what we got. And because our baggage were lost in transit, we had to buy a toothbrush, a comb and a few things like that. They charged us an exhorbitant price for cheap stuff that you could probably get at 5 for a buck at a dollar store. I was really not impressed with that.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jayemwright
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We did a Park and Fly when going to Cuba. The service was incredible. Timely drop-off and pick up to and from Dorval Airport and early check in. We had a late night flight from Varadero, arriving in Montreal at 7:00 AM. I had asked for an early check in, and they had apologetically said that they couldn't do anything before 9:00. That was fine. However, when we were dropped off at the hotel at 7:30 by the van that picked us up within 5 minutes of our calling, the man at the front desk told us " I searched the hotel and found you the last available room-Have a good rest", This is typical of the service you receive. They will even drop you off at the nearest Metro stop, so you can go and explore Montreal, one of my favourite cities in the world. The facility itself is a bit dated, but very clean. It is the incredible commitment to service that makes this place an outstanding place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “smelly hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrogWhizzer
Reviews.Content: I am writing to express my displeasure at my recent stay at the above mentioned Hotel. My wife and I both went to Montreal for surgery at Laservue. We arrived and were given our room which was very gracious and fairly clean. Apparently there had been some kind of a sewage leak in the hallway because the hall reeked of a strange odor. Aside from that the rest was fine until we returned from Laservue on the second day and went for our complementary breakfast. When we arrived at the Jardines Le Pavillon we were greeted and seated. At this time I was told that only 1 breakfast was going to be free. When I asked why I was told by (Yaminie)? The waiter that that was the way it was. He also informed us rather rudely that the buffet was not available as it was being moved. This was at 9:30 and the hours listed stated that breakfast was served until 10:30. He definitely had an attitude problem that day.I went to the front desk to check on this and was told by Diana that was right. She stated that if the others were covered she would have given me more cards. The card did not specify how many people were included and at no time was this mentioned when I checked in. I realize that this may not seem like a big deal to you but I travel a lot and this is the only time I have ever incurred this. Every other Hotel â€“Motel We have stayed the breakfast was for all in the party.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: EllinLu2
Reviews.Content: My parents booked this hotel as it was reccomended by the clinic who performed their Laser View eye surgery. I was very suprised to see a 4 star rating on the paperwork at the hotel because I would not even come close to rating it that high. When they booked they were told that our reservation had American breakfast included witch we found out the next day was for only one of us staying in the room.Hmm intresting. Anyhow this hotel is in the worse place I have ever stayed in my life! No views... rude wait staff in the dinning room and the hall had the aroma of vomit. The nicest part of the hotel was the lobby they had a beautiful fish pond. The beds were harder than a rock although the rooms were nice size. The bathroom was a little on the dirty side but it was nicely stocked with shampoo and lotions and such. The walls of the hotel were very thin. Listening to someone piddle in the next room was almost as attractive as the kid who cried most of the night. (although it could have been worse...RIGHT!!) The location of this hotel is awful. If your looking for some place to walk do not book here. it is on the dirtiest highway with nothing around at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Nicky1971
Reviews.Content: Friendly and personalized service. Personalized chocolate plate in room and a glass of champagne given at check-in. Complimentary Shuttle service, not only to the airport, but to the metro (subway) station, train station, shopping mall... Rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff really does what it takes to make you feel welcome. Amazing for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality at the Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonLass2006
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel to try it out as I flew in from London, UK and had an early flight out the next morning to western Canada. I've stayed before at the Hilton and the Best Western, as these hotels are also very close to Dorval, so convenient for early air travel. The transfers to and from the hotel were very good, the bus arrived at the airport for pickup after a 5 minute wait, and the bus leaves the hotel every 30 minutes (on the hour and half hour) to go to the airport which was fine. The hotel isn't as close to the airport as the Hilton or the Best Western, but it was only a 5 minute drive. My room, though a little on the small side, was very nice, clean and modern. When I entered the room, I saw there was a plate with 3 chocolates and on the plate, was a message, Welcome with my name that was written in chocolate - so that was a nice touch. I ordered room service, and was pleasantly surprised when it arrived within 10 minutes and the food was hot. Front desk check-in and check-out was professional and friendly. I plan to stay there again on my next trip.
